definition: prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
stripes of a tiger/"tiger" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 141)
male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
subjugated people/refugee from a destroyed country
Tartar (derogatory)/also used as an insulting term for Manchus around 1900
expel the Manchu, revolutionary slogan from around 1900

sentences.english: In addition Krupp thousand men and women who, three thousand cattle horses.
sentences.chinese: 此外虜男女一萬二千人，牛馬三萬餘匹。

sentences.english: The natives thought the explorer was possessed by a fiend.
sentences.chinese: 當地人認爲，這個冒險家被一個魔鬼虜去了。

definition: to put (a criminal) to death/to punish
short name for Liaoning 遼寧|辽宁[Liao2 ning2] province/Liao or Khitan dynasty (907-1125)
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
